title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Agostón White (Cariñena)
description: This colorless blend of Viura and Chardonnay smells tropical and sweet, like lychee fruit. A palate lacking in acidic edge is round but flat. Sugary papaya flavors precede a soft finish.

title: Big Smooth 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Obvious spicy and smoky oak aromas lead to equally strong oak flavors in this fruity two-dimensional wine. It has medium body and moderate tannins that give a little support to the otherwise sweet-seeming flavors.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2016 Conde Valdemar Viura-Verdejo White (Rioja)
description: Oxidized aromas dull down papaya and pumpkin notes. This Viura-Verdejo blend shows mostly acid on the palate, and it both smells and tastes oxidized. The finish is bland.

title: Burgo Viejo 2016 Tinto  (Rioja)
description: Reduced berry and plum aromas suggest rubber gloves. An acidic, saucy palate struggles for balance. Tart plum and currant flavors recall tomato sauce, while this wine is dry and grating on the finish.

title: Caligiore 2014 Organic Single Vineyard Syrah (Mendoza)
description: Oaky tones dominate the nose. On the palate, this wine feels resiny and rubbery. Weedy, woody berry flavors are acceptable, but this wine is discordant.

title: Rutini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)
description: Punchy aromas are lean, low on fruit, and lead to a watery but fresh palate. This wine tastes fairly green and bitter, while peppery pyrazine-based flavors dominate the finish.

title: Tierra Del Sol 2015 Estate Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (La Rioja)
description: Heavy aromas of toast and oak are matched by black olive. This feels fairly abrasive and tannic. Flavors of coffee grounds and mulchy berry fruits end with notes of green herbs and olive paste.

title: Château Langlais 2016 Les Bories de Langlais  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: With no added sulfites and from organically grown grapes, this bottling ventures into natural wine territory. However, it suffers from a tinny character that can affect these wines and shows some hints of volatility. The second bottle tasted was less volatile.

title: 2Plank 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: An overt, almost raw oakiness overwhelms the grape flavors in this full-bodied, tannic and tight wine. It smells strongly like cedar and toasted oak, tastes spicy and woody, and feels astringent on the palate.

title: Funckenhausen 2017 Dry Rosé (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of suntan lotion and fruit salad are unconvincing. This rosé in a one-liter bottle is heavy in feel, with a texture suggestive of grape skins. Soapy persimmon flavors control the finish.

title: Laroque 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)
description: Straightforward and direct, this offers clean and just-ripe notes of cherry, strawberry and banana on the nose and mouth. The lightweight palate is easy and short, with little tannic structure. Drink up.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne

title: Palacio del Burgo 2016 Tinto  (Rioja)
description: Jammy berry aromas are a bit volatile, with latex and bramble notes in the background. Scattershot and acidic on the palate, this wine tastes of high-toned saucy berry and plum. It has a pulling finish with tart plum notes.

title: Bodegas Tempore 2016 Esenzia Old Vine Garnacha (Bajo Aragon)
description: Candied aromas of berry fruits and raisin are not fresh or focused. This wine has a stewy feel along with gummy flavors of blackened berry fruits. Touches of clove, licorice and mint register on the finish.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Malbec Cabernet Made With Organic Grapes Rosé (Tupungato)
description: A funky nose is rustic and lightly oxidized. This blend of Malbec and Cabernet feels chunky, with a sense of grape skins to the palate. Stale grapefruit flavors are salty and slightly bitter on the finish.
designation: Malbec Cabernet Made With Organic Grapes

title: Big Vine 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This older vintage wine is dusty in red cassis and currant with a dullness to the palate that makes it hard to decipher or recommend.

title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Arnozan Réserve des Chartrons  (Lussac Saint-Émilion)
description: This wine is fruity but has a lean texture that emphasizes tannins rather than fruit. With a dry core and bitter-chocolate flavors, the wine misses out on the fruit.

title: Quara 2017 Estate Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Oily aromas of boiled ham and lychee lead to a plump and chunky palate that feels flat. Full tropical flavors are soapy and heavy with pyrazines, while this wine feels oily and tastes bitter on the finish.

title: Tomero 2016 Chardonnay (Uco Valley)
description: Light in color, with lean, stalky aromas that barely suggest fruit, this Chardonnay feels citric and angular. Flavors of white grape skins and pyrazines finish tart, green and lemony.

title: Argenses 2016 Winemakers Classic Block #18 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Earthy, soupy plum and berry aromas do not improve with airing. In the mouth, this wine is obtuse and shapeless. Peppery, underdeveloped berry flavors precede a short but rough finish.

title: Auburn 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills Lake County)
description: Raw and smoky oak aromas and a drying mouthfeel make this an extreme-style wine. The texture is astringent and gives the low-level fruit flavors a bitter edge.

title: Domenico 2012 Syrah (Amador County)
description: This is an unusual take on the grape varietal. The wine has an aroma like sunbaked earth and mature, almost sweet flavors of maple and toffee.

title: Merriam 2013 Windacre Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)
description: Puckering and somewhat green, this wine is black in color and too muddled to recommend.

title: Reyes 2013 Renaissance Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Slightly unclean aromas of lemon peel, wet dirt and damp sand show on the nose of this bottling. Dried lemon rinds and brackish-water flavors show on the sip.

title: Tapiz 2017 Alta Collection Malbec Rosé (Mendoza)
description: This dark rosé smells of rhubarb and clove, with muddled tropical fruits on the palate and a bit of residual sugar on the finish.

title: Cruz Alta 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A light color and weedy aromas of candied berry fruits are unappealing. This wine feels raw and closed, with no depth. Grassy plum flavors are bland, while this tastes odd and artificial on the finish.

title: Luminis 2016 Allamand Cuveé Saint Jeannet (Luján de Cuyo)
description: This unique grape originates from France, where it is also called Gros Vert. This wine has barnyard aromas on the nose and feels lean and lemony, with minerality. One-note lemony flavors linger on the finish.

title: Restivo 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Weedy aromas of green fruits are jumbled and messy. High acidity creates a raw, almost caustic palate. A lead flavor of oaky clove seems forced and fake, while the rest of this Malbec is tart, with touches of red currant and plum.

title: Roza Ridge 2015 Zinfandel (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: The aromas bring notes of vanilla, cherry cough syrup and spice. The sweet fruit and spice flavors show a lot of warmth.

title: Luscatel NV Semi-Sweet Gold Rose Sparkling (Spain)
description: Grassy, soapy aromas lead off this semisweet rosé sparkler. A sugary palate shows no acidic edge, while this tastes like vanilla extract and candy. A soft finish is devoid of freshness.

title: One Leaf 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a basic red wine with plummy flavors that are nearly sweet, and a soft slightly sugary palate. It's simple and forgettable.
